Specific Details: The Association, local residents, boat owners and other harbour users were informed by the  Development Company, Bartra, that they had purchased the former Western Marine Site in Bullock Harbour and that the company intended to apply for permission  to develop the site
DPOs Lobbied: John Bailey|Councillor|Dun Laoghaire-Rathdown County Council::Cormac Devlin|Councillor|Dun Laoghaire-Rathdown County Council::Mary Fayne|Councillor|Dun Laoghaire-Rathdown County Council::Melisa Halpin|Councillor|Dun Laoghaire-Rathdown County Council::Michael Merrigan|Councillor|Dun Laoghaire-Rathdown County Council::Ossian Smyth|Councillor|Dun Laoghaire-Rathdown County Council::David O'Keeffe|Councillor|Dun Laoghaire-Rathdown County Council
Subject Matter: The Association, local residents, boat owners and other harbour users were informed by the  Development Company, Bartra, that they had purchased the former Western Marine Site in Bullock Harbour and that the company intended to apply for permission  to develop the site
Intended Results: We intended to seek to ensure that any development on the site would be appropriate in design, size and usage to its heritage, its current  maritime uses and in a scale which in keeping with existing residential buildings in the harbour area.
Lobbying Activities: This was a meeting with Councillors from the Dun Laoghaire Electoral area on 19th December at which we informed them of our concerns at the proposals of which we had been informed by Bartra management and a representative of the company's Architects|Meeting|1
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Flor O'Mahony, together with 10-14 other members or supporters of the Association - all on a voluntary basis as part of a community based
Grassroots directive: To request audiences to request the Planning Authority to reject the proposals of which the developers had informed us.

Specific Details: Community supports and activities for those affected by people with Parkinson's
DPOs Lobbied: Cormac Devlin|Councillor|Dun Laoghaire-Rathdown County Council::Mary Hanafin|Councillor|Dun Laoghaire-Rathdown County Council::Mary Mitchell O'Connor|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: Community supports and activities for those affected by people with Parkinson's
Intended Results: Increased awareness of supports provided by Move4Parkinsons' in the south dublin and wicklow areas::Increased understanding of the benefits and value of community based classes and programmes in the health of people with Parksinson's - so that if future asks are made around policy or funding, the DPO would be aware of these
Lobbying Activities: Set dancing afternoon event 14 October, The Graduate Killiney and Christmas Concert Sat 8th December, Christchurch, Dun Laoghaire. Each of these events were ticketed events open to all. The set dancing event was a ceili held primarily for people with Parkinson's and family members. The Christmas Concert featured our choirs and the children of St Nicholas Montessori school. At both events DPOs were invited to attend, speeches were made to all attendees highlighting the work Move4Parkinson's does and the benefits of this. Some DPOs were also engaged in individual informal conversations highlighting our work in the community and the benefits to people with parkinson's|Event / Reception|2-5

Specific Details: Meeting and correspondence relating to the draft Circular Economy Bill
DPOs Lobbied: Cormac Devlin|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Alan Farrell|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: Meeting and correspondence relating to the draft Circular Economy Bill
Intended Results: To highlight concerns with the current drafting of section 28 of the Bill (waste recovery levy) and the potential for unintended consequences in light of the same.
Lobbying Activities:
CEWEP Ireland (Jackie Keaney and Kieran Mullins) met with Cormac Devlin, TD on 28 April. 
The purpose of the meeting was to highlight concerns with the current drafting of section 28 of the draft Circular Economy Bill (waste recovery levy) and the potential for unintended consequences in light of the same. 
Draft amendments on behalf of CEWEP Ireland were provided in advance of the Dail Environment and Climate Committee review of the draft Bill.|Meeting|1::On 29 April, Seamus Flynn on behalf of CEWEP Ireland provided Alan Farrell TD, with draft amendments to the Circular Economy Bill in order to highlight concerns with the current drafting of section 28 of the Bill (waste recovery levy) and the potential for unintended consequences in light of the same. 
The purpose of this communication was to ascertain if the proposed amendments could be tabled in Seanad Eireann following examination of the Bill by the Dail Environment and Climate Committee.|Email|2-5

Specific Details: The CEO of HealthTech Ireland, Susan Treacy, with members of the Board and HealthTech Ireland presenting to Members of the Oireachtas in Dáil AV room on the topic of ‘Unlocking HealthTech’s Innovation and Insights for a Sustainable Healthcare System through Public-Private Collaboration’. This was followed by patient advocate and HealthTech Ireland employee, Molly Carroll describing a patient perspective on the topic. A Q and A followed with attendees.
DPOs Lobbied: Cormac Devlin|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: The CEO of HealthTech Ireland, Susan Treacy, with members of the Board and HealthTech Ireland presenting to Members of the Oireachtas in Dáil AV room on the topic of ‘Unlocking HealthTech’s Innovation and Insights for a Sustainable Healthcare System through Public-Private Collaboration’. This was followed by patient advocate and HealthTech Ireland employee, Molly Carroll describing a patient perspective on the topic. A Q and A followed with attendees.
Intended Results: In strategies, government aspires for sector collaboration. Presenting in the AV Dail room we highlighted the significant footprint of health tech in Ireland and thriving indigenous sector with the aim of highlighting opportunities for leadership in transformation, possibilities when capability is created to openly collaborate with industry leaders with suitable governance. To demonstrate value already delivered by us and the public sector in the areas of procurement, sustainability and digital.
